title: file deleted with special char in file name (not umlaut)
body:
i am on the current owncloud server release 4.5.7. win2003 iis,  php 5.4.10

owncloud client 1.2.1 on windows 7 x64

last night, i setup the sync of my dropbox folder from windows 7 to owncloud (on my server).  the files are efs encrypted on the win2003 ntfs file system.  owncloud does not seem to mind (as it shouldn't care if the right api is used).

while the initial sync was ongoing a certain file, an android apk backup file containing the "trademark" character, was automatically deleted.  i watched dropbox announce this to me. (dropbox also sync's 2-way)  after i restored it it happened again.  i restored a copy of the file without the tm character.  the new version has not been deleted by owncloud.

file = "skype mobileâ„¢-144.apk"

a second file, which was an image file (no special chars) was also deleted.  i manually restored it without issue it seems.

i am confident that dropbox had nothing to do with this since this file has been present for over a year in the dropbox folder.

i have been able to replicate this with a random file that has a "tm" char. (alt 0153)
i suggest someone test this with a similar file.  i am not sure that anything but the "tm" char is relevant here.
